intro: Tillandsia eeckhouteri, commonly known as the Eeckhouteri air plant, is a species of epiphytic bromeliad native to the tropical regions of South America. It thrives in humid environments and does not require soil, instead absorbing moisture and nutrients through its specialized leaves. The plant features rosette-shaped foliage that can range in color from green to reddish-brown, depending on light exposure. It produces striking, bell-shaped inflorescences that are often pink or purple, adding visual interest to its appearance. Due to its unique growth habits and aesthetic appeal, it is a popular choice for indoor gardening and terrariums.
